content.text:
During this lesson, we will review the **key findings** of a study commissioned by Spotify, which looked to quantify the reach and quality of our free audience in 10 countries across Europe.

Following this, we will take an **in depth look** at listener behaviour in the **UK.**

You can use this information when **selling air time** to companies interested in advertising on Spotify.

Continue to review the key findings of the study.

slides.templateDescription: Display a list of bullet points

list.title: Spotify’s free service delivers unique audience reach.
list.content:
In 8 of 10 markets, Spotify is the **top audio
streaming service.** The average incremental reach is 10%

list.title: Spotify’s audience listens across the day, making it a strong compliment to an audio buy.
list.content: While radio listening activity overindexes in the morning, Spotify listening **builds steadily throughout the day,** peaking in the afternoon and early evening.

list.title: Spotify captures attention.
list.content: **40%** of Spotify Free listeners on average pay full or most of their attention when they're listening, **considerably higher** than most commercial radio stations.

data.title: Select the graph which matches Spotify listening behaviour.

answer.text:
Spotify is unique against its radio competitors in that listening **builds steadily throughout the day,** rather than peaking in the morning.

This means that potential clients have a wider array of **Dayparts** to send out effective advertising in when using Spotify.

question.content: Select the graph which matches Spotify listening behaviour.

data.prompt: Drag to set the correct value

answer.text: 40% of listeners pay **full** or **most attention** while listening to Spotify Free - this is considerably higher than listeners of commercial radio stations, and should be mentioned when talking to potential clients.

data.title: What percentage of Spotify listeners pay attention while they are listening?

question.content: What percentage of Spotify listeners pay attention while they are listening?

data.subtitle: Continue to review an in depth look at Spotify's reach compared to radio stations in the UK
data.title: **Listener behaviour in the UK**

content.text:
Spotify provides significant incremental reach to **every radio station in the UK** and across **all age groups,** with up to 21% added reach among 15-34 year-olds.

Spotify has a **14%** incremental reach in relation to
both **Heart FM and Capital FM,** and **15%** in relation to
**Kiss FM.**

Spotify is the **second most active** listening ‘radio
station’ in the UK compared to commercial stations, and with an overall weekly reach of **14.4%,** Spotify is the **second-largest digital music service** in the UK.
True to the global Spotify trend, Spotify listening in the UK **builds steadily throughout the day** and peaks in the evening, while radio listening **peaks during morning drive-time.**

data.title: **About Spotify's position in the UK radio market**

data.prompt: Drag to set the correct value

answer.text:
Spotify has: 
- A **14%** incremental reach in relation to both Heart FM and Capital FM.
- A **15%** in relation to Kiss FM.

Be sure to remember these numbers when pitching to potential clients, as each of thee are key competitors in the UK market.

data.title: What incremental reach does Spotify have over UK radio stations?

question.category: What incremental reach does Spotify have over UK radio stations?
What incremental reach does Spotify have over UK radio stations?
What incremental reach does Spotify have over UK radio stations?

answer.text: Spotify is the **second-largest** digital music service in the UK, with a **14.4% weekly reach** (second only to iTunes).

data.title: Tap in order of size in the UK digital service market

question.content: Tap in order of size in the UK digital service market

data.prompt: Put the items in the correct order

answer.text:
Spotify is the **second most active** listening ‘radio
station’ in the UK compared to commercial stations.

data.title: Put the 'listening radio stations' in descending order of most to least active.

question.content: Put the 'listening radio stations' in descending order of most to least active.

data.content: Nice work. You've completed this lesson.
data.title: **That's it!**
